intro: Carpotroche linguifolia, commonly known as the tongueleaf cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, tongue-shaped leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
